prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism as the first part of the assembly. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles for this coordinate system should be [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector should be [0.0, 0.1673, 0.502]. Now, create the 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Face 1 of the sketch contains a single loop (loop_1) made up of four lines. These lines are: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.254, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.254, 0.0], End Point [0.254, 0.248] * Line 3: Start Point [0.254, 0.248], End Point [0.0, 0.248] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.248], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale, which is 0.254 in this case. Transform this scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector, creating a 3D model with the specified extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal of 0.1673. This results in a final shape with the following dimensions: length - 0.254, width - 0.1673, and height - 0.254. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a tapered end Create the second part of the assembly as a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Define the new coordinate system by setting the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and the translation vector to [0.0535, 0.1623, 0.502]. Draw the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. Face 1 of the sketch contains a single loop (loop_1) made up of a circle. The circle has the following properties: * Center: [0.0715, 0.0715] * Radius: 0.0715 Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale, which is 0.1429.Transform this scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to form a 3D model with the given extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal of 0.502. The final shape has the following dimensions: length - 0.1429, width - 0.1429, and height - 0.502. Perform a JoinFeatureOperation for this part with the preceding CAD model.</description>
